text.p: The first thing to do with Matlab is to make sure you can start it and then we'll do some simple calculations.
Go ahead and start Matlab. You should see a window with a command prompt (the > on the left side of the window).

1. At the command prompt type the command
> 2 + 3
Hit return and enter the result here.

2. Do the following computations using Matlab. (Enter your answers in the boxes.)
> 2*3

3. Use Matlab to do the following computation. (Enter your answer in the box.)
> 100*mean(sin(30:87))
4. Now we'll do our first random simulation. Don't worry if you don't fully understand the commands. We will explain them in the first tutorial.
In order to simulate counting the number of heads in 1000 tosses of a fair coin give the following sequence of commands (hit return after each one).
You can use the up arrow to go back and run the commands again. You should get a different total.
Give the value of the total number of heads for one of your simulations.
